sn12.54:1.2: “Mendicants, suppose an oil lamp depended on oil and a wick to burn.
sn12.54:1.3: And from time to time someone would pour oil in and adjust the wick.
sn12.54:1.4: Fueled and sustained by that, the oil lamp would burn for a long time.
sn12.54:1.5: In the same way, there are things that are prone to being fettered. When you concentrate on the gratification provided by these things, your craving grows.
sn12.54:1.6: Craving is a condition for grasping. …
sn12.54:1.7: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.54:2.1: Suppose an oil lamp depended on oil and a wick to burn.
sn12.54:2.2: And no-one would pour oil in and adjust the wick from time to time.
sn12.54:2.3: As the original fuel is used up and no more is added, the oil lamp would be extinguished due to lack of fuel.
sn12.54:2.4: In the same way, there are things that are prone to being fettered. When you concentrate on the drawbacks of these things, your craving ceases.
sn12.54:2.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
